sub_topic: Maximum modulus principle and minimum modulus principle
message_1: Suppose $f(z)$ is an entire function such that $|f(z)| \leq 5$ for all $z \in \mathbb{C}$. Find the maximum and minimum values of $|f(\pi)|.$
message_2:
Since $f(z)$ is an entire function, it can be represented by a power series converging for all $z \in \mathbb{C}$. By Liouville's theorem, any bounded entire function must be constant. Therefore, $f(z) = c$ for some constant $c \in \mathbb{C}$.

Since $|f(z)| \leq 5$ for all $z \in \mathbb{C}$, we have $|c| \leq 5$. Thus, the maximum and minimum values of $|f(\pi)| = |c|$ are 5 and 0, respectively.
